Description: Marble portrait bust of Germanicus Caesar.
Curator's comments: This is one of four replicas of the portrait type of Germanicus associated with his adoption by Tiberius in AD 4. The two best replicas are the basalt bust from Egypt in the British Museum (Cat 1883) and a marble head in the Louvre (MA 3135). In addition, there is a replica in Munich (Residenz) and this bust, both damaged or reworked and therefore less reliable. Cf. A.-K. Massner, Bildnisangleichung (Berlin 1982), 86f.
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (1884)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Thomas Bruce, 7th Earl of Elgin
